channel.title: What Are Your Specs?
channel.description:
I've seen a few threads 'bout recommending different GPUs and stuff, but I can't seem to find a solid thread to share specifications.
My current PC is crap, so Im building a new one. Let me know what you think? (I want it to run Battlefield 3 on Ultra)
Cpu:AMD FX-6100 6 Cores @ 3.3Ghz Gpu: GeForce GTX 560 (Fermi) 1GB (is it worth upgrading to 2gb?) Motherboard: Gigabyte AMD 970 Ram: 8Gb (4x2Gb G-Skill Ripjaws) 500Gb Hard drive 550w Power Supply
[COLOR='Red']So what are your specs?[/SIZE]

item.title: What Are Your Specs?
item.dc:creator: ThEGr33k
item.description:
Yep, custom builds are a piece of piss. Hardest thing is making sure all the parts are right for each other (and that aint really difficult). But then you ask the likes of us to check out what you are looking at ordering to make sure. After that its super easy, just dont force anything in the wrong way and bam done. Money saved and pride in your work!

Read full topic

item.title: What Are Your Specs?
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
I would go with a custom build, even if you don’t know much about computers, it’s pretty much like legos(Just make sure you don’t try and connect them with mega blocks lol xD.)

You should have more trust in yourself, trust me a custom build will be easier on your wallet and give you more bang for your buck. I don’t trust buying anything PC related from Amazon, but that’s just a grudge I have against them.

Read full topic

item.title: What Are Your Specs?
item.dc:creator: amazingcomedy
item.description:
NerdRage:

Personally I’d build my own. If you don’t feel comfortable doing that, check out https://www.cyberpowerpc.com/ You pick the parts, they put it together. Bought my first PC from them, they are good.

Wow, nice site, although I might still order the PC in the link I provided. I’m not a caveman when it comes to tech stuff, I have a fairly decent amount of knowledge on it, but I’m not too sure if I trust myself to get a good custom build. Thanks for the website anyways, though, if I have doubts on this, I’ll be sure to try it out.

Read full topic

item.title: What Are Your Specs?
item.dc:creator: NerdRage
item.description:
amazingcomedy:

I might get a Radeon HD, and maybe a Quad core too. Intel’s processors do wonders. Do you think I should just save up my money and get one of these?: https://www.amazon.com/Gateway-FX6860-UR20P-Gaming-Desktop-Black/dp/tech-data/B0050JSJU4/ref=de_a_smtd

From what I’ve seen, this is a great gaming PC. Just read the tech details.

Personally I’d build my own. If you don’t feel comfortable doing that, check out https://www.cyberpowerpc.com/ You pick the parts, they put it together. Bought my first PC from them, they are good.

As for my specs:
Case: Haf X
CPU: Intel i5 750 @ 4GHz
Cooler: V8
Memory: 8GB 1600MHz
GPU: 2x ATI 5850 (crossfire)
Mobo: Asus P7P55D LE
HDD (Games and porn): 2x 512GB (RAID 1)
SSD (Boot and programs): 128GB
PSU: Ultra X4 750w
Windows 7 Pro

Read full topic

item.title: What Are Your Specs?
item.dc:creator: ThEGr33k
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

Guess I’ll post mine. They’ll change soon enough, I want to swap out the processor, which means swapping out the mobo and RAM as well.

Windows 7 Enterprise 64 bit (lol “work at home” yeah right)
Core 2 6600 2.4 GHz (currently overclocked to 2.85 GHz, could probably go higher, but meh, idc right now)
8 GB DDR2 (4x 2GB )
MSI P6N SLI Platinum
GeForce GTX 470 (debating whether to replace this, keep it, or buy a better card and SLI them together, need to fix heat first if I keep it)
1TB 5200 RPM HDD (I know, I need a faster drive, gonna get one when I get everything else, maybe more than one, but I’ll probably wait to buy extras until HDD prices go back down)

Ill say stick to single core GPU, Crossfire and SLi are both a PITA!!! You often dont gain anything and most of the time have driver issues. Stick to the best single core card you can!

Id also say that with that setup the bottleneck will very likely be with the CPU, especially if its the 2 core E6600? I know my Q6600 @3GHz was the bottleneck with a lower spec 9800GTX!

Read full topic

item.title: What Are Your Specs?
item.dc:creator: Phat
item.description:
CPU- i7-2600K@4,6Ghz (cooled by noctua NH-D14)
MOBO- Gbyte Z68X-UD7-B3
GPU AMD 6970(2Gb)
RAM- 8Gigs of Transcend 2000Mhz
PSU- CM 1000watts (something)
this used to be the best PSU cm had, I also had to change its fan it was making too much noise now it has a Scythe fan works really nice
CASE - Gigabyte 3D Aurora black- my trusty old case modified to fit a 6970 (with a hammer- srsly) and I cut out a window in it.
I also have a NZXT fan controller and all the fans are from Noctua
HDD - WD 2TB black (the one with sata3 “support”) and it’s encased in a Scythe thingy passive cooling thingy

I plan on modding the case a bit more and I want to add an SSD and another 6970

EDIT - forgot to brag about peripherals
Logitech G51 surround speakers
Logitech G510 keyboard (it has fancy LGBT lights)
Logitech something ergonomic wireless mouse
Samsung T220HD 22 inches I can even watch telly on it
also
Broken DVD-RW reader

Strange how I have a fancier computer than you guise since I live in a 3rd world country.
EDIT: checked on wiki and it seems that my county has been promoted to a 2nd world country lolwut
EDIT2: nothing makes sense on wiki

Read full topic

item.title: What Are Your Specs?
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
The average build for the average gamer. The average gamer with a screen fetish.

CPU - AMD Phenom II x2 550 Black Edition 3.1Ghz( <<< Unlocked to x3 and OC’d @3.7Ghz )
RAM - 2x2Gb OCZ Gold DDR2 1066Mhz
MOBO - Asus M4A77D
GPU - 1Gb Sapphire HD5850 ‘Toxic’
STORAGE - 700Gb, 1Tb, 1Tb. All Seagate, all 7200rpm.
CASE - Cheap ass crap
COOLING - Arctic Cooling Freezer 7pro + lots of 120mm fans
SOUND - Logitech X-530’s + Logitech G35 headset
SCREEN - 26" HannsG Widescreen, and x2 17" Viewsonic 4;3’s
MOUSE - Coolermaster Sentinel Zero-G
KEYBOARD - Cheap ass logitech crap
PERIPHERALS - Fanatec GT2 steering wheel, Logitech G25 Pedals, Lightning SST 8-speed shifter, wired 360 pad

My cpu makes me smile. It was bought as a dual core, runs as a tri core, but cpu-z detects it as a quad core
Here are some pics I found. Might take better ones later;



I wish the case internals were blue to match, well, almost everything else. Might spray them

Read full topic
